string.value: The Birth of Shinjo
Let's go check with #b#p1102002##k, the Mount Instructor, to see whether your Mount will recover its health if it goes into the special Incubator.

#p1102002# says he's done everything he could but the Mount keeps getting weaker and weaker. As a last resort, he suggests you seek help from #b#p1101001##k. He then hints that you may gain something more valuable if you #bsincerely devote time and energy to your Mount#k.
The Mount which #p1101001# had revived was not the same #t1902006#.
Let's put your Mount in the special Incubator.
Oh no! Not only did it do no good for your Mount, but your Mount is getting significantly weaker by the second. It must be because it's apart from its master. Oh boy, I'm so sorry. It's all my fault!
Oh, I can't just stand here and watch him get weaker and weaker... What do I do? I can't be responsible for losing your Mount... Oh! I've got an idea. Let's ask #b#p1101001##k for help!
Every Mount that belongs to a Knight begins as an illusory creature summoned by #p1101001#. If anyone can save your Mount, it is #p1101001#. Take your Mount to see #p1101001#.
I wish there were other options, but there aren't any. No one other than #p1101001# can help you this time.

#t1902006# you have with you is an illusory creature I summoned. You are the one who gave your Mount the strength to exist in this world, but it has weakened over time and exhausted its strength by participating in your battles. It may be time to let #t1902006# go.
#b#L0#Isn't there a way I can be with my Mount?#l
#L1#I will let my Mount go.#l
#k

With the power of #t1902006#, you have become incredibly strong. Even if you kept #t1902006# in this world, it will not perform as it had in the past. It will only burden you with extra responsibilities. Would you still like to keep #t1902006#?
#b#L0#Then I do not wish to keep #t1902006# anymore.#l
#L1#I still want to be with my Mount.#l
#k

#t1902006# has become exhausted over time and is suffering from fatigue. You may be happy to have a companion by you, but dragging #t1902006# around may only exacerbate its condition. #t1902006# is in desperate need of rest, but you still wish to keep your Mount in this world?
#b#L0#If #t1902006# is suffering from pain, I'll let my Mount go.#l
#L1#I still wish to be with my Mount.#l
#k
If you say so. I will send #t1902006# back to where it belongs.
I've sent your Mount back once, but it has come back on its own... #t1902006# seems to want to stay by you.
Your sincere request and your #t1902006#'s strong will combined have recreated #t1902006#. #bShinjo#k is its name. You don't need my help any more. You two will be just fine.
Congratulations on acquiring an eternal companion.
Don't you have any regrets?
You're extremely cold-hearted.
Must you do something Mimio really does not want?
Where is your #t1902006#?
